title: Aracely's Flan Recipe
description: This is an authentic and simple flan recipe that is steamed not baked. It has been passed down through 4 generations and is requested at every family gathering. It is to die for!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Aracely's Flan 4.3 (40) 38 Reviews 4 Photos This is a very authentic and simple flan recipe that is steamed not baked. It has been passed down through 4 generations and is requested at every family gathering. It is to die for! Submitted by Sally Pusch Published on March 4, 2020 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 10 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 50 mins Servings: 10 Yield: 10 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 10 egg yolks 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk 3 tablespoons margarine 3 tablespoons brown sugar Directions Whisk together the yolks, condensed milk, and evaporated milk; set aside. Melt margarine in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the brown sugar; keep stirring until the brown sugar has dissolved, and is smooth. Evenly spread the sugar over the bottom of a pie plate, then pour in the custard. Cover with foil. (See Cook's Note.) Fill a large pot approximately 3/4 full with water and bring to a simmer on the stove. Place the pie plate over the simmering water and cook for 65 to 70 minutes, until flan has set. Remove flan from the boiling water and allow to cool for at least 30 minutes. To serve, loosen the flan from the pie plate by running a knife around the edges; invert onto a serving plate. Serve at room temperature or cold. Cook's Note: Since this flan is cooked on the stovetop and not in the oven, it's important to have a pie plate with handles and an appropriately sized, large pan. The two must fit together well, securely holding the pie plate over the simmering water while the flan cooks. I Made It Print 45 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 268 Calories 14g Fat 29g Carbs 8g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 268 % Daily Value * Total Fat 14g 17% Saturated Fat 6g 30% Cholesterol 228mg 76% Sodium 132mg 6% Total Carbohydrate 29g 11% Total Sugars 29g Protein 8g 16% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 226mg 17% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 274mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Aracely's Flan 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  NorCaliChick 05/13/2018 Made this for the first time ever and it is amazing!!! I altered the recipe just a bit, use 3 eggs (whites and yolks), and it’s so so yummy!!! 03 of 04 Photo by  Lemmonsgirl 05/28/2007 I liked the idea of making the flan in the bundt cake pan, it made a pretty presentation, I did overcook it a little so it turned a little too brown, see photo. But, it still had a good flavor and was completely gone at the potluck I took it to. The brown sugar in the bottom did not all come out with the flan when I inverted it, so much of it was still had stuck to the inside of the pan. Very difficult to clean (my husband can attest to it.) I did steam the flan in the oven. If I make it again, I will use a different carmel sauce. 1 You’ll Also Love Coconut Flan 50 Ratings Flan de Coco (Coconut Flan) 128 Ratings Flan de Queso (Cream Cheese Flan) 64 Ratings Coconut Milk Flan 17 Ratings White Chocolate Flan 4 Ratings Creamy Caramel Flan 705 Ratings Super Easy Cream Cheese Flan 5 Ratings Caramel-Glazed Flan 119 Ratings Microwave Flan 25 Ratings Baked Flan 514 Ratings Pumpkin Flan 7 Absolutely Irresistible Mexican Flan Recipes Original Mexican Flan Napolitano 3 Ratings Sous Vide Flan 12 Ratings Simple and Creamy Spanish Flan 9 Ratings Mango Pudding (Flan de Mango) 19 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Sally Pusch
instructions: Whisk together the yolks, condensed milk, and evaporated milk; set aside. Melt margarine in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the brown sugar; keep stirring until the brown sugar has dissolved, and is smooth. Evenly spread the sugar over the bottom of a pie plate, then pour in the custard. Cover with foil. (See Cook's Note.);Fill a large pot approximately 3/4 full with water and bring to a simmer on the stove. Place the pie plate over the simmering water and cook for 65 to 70 minutes, until flan has set. Remove flan from the boiling water and allow to cool for at least 30 minutes.;To serve, loosen the flan from the pie plate by running a knife around the edges; invert onto a serving plate. Serve at room temperature or cold.
